Package main.java.screens

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ControlledScreen
    ControlledScreen is an interface that has some attributes and methods that must be common in all classes that implement it.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CreateMenuController
    This class outputs a Screen that allows an user to create new accounts (User classes) in order to log in into the application.
    CreateTask
    CreateTask outputs a screen that allows the current user to create a new task.
    EditTask
    EditTask outputs a javaFX screen that interacts with the user, allowing the latter to edit a selected task.
    FileListController
    FileListController outputs a javaFX screen that lists all of the selected task's files.
    LoginController
    LoginController provides the first javaFX screen for interaction with the User.
    ScreenController
    ScreenController is a class that manages all the screens.
    ScreenFramework
    This class encapsulates all the resource fxml files and controller IDs in a simple framework.
    ToDoController
    ToDoController is the most vital controller in all of the application since it's this class that controls the application's main screen, which contains most of the used UI objects and provides most of the application's interaction capabilities.
